resources.string:
Set your daily sunlight target here.
We recommend as little as 15-30 min a day to lift your mood, improve concentration and aid your goodnight sleep.
Receive daily reminders to go outside and enjoy natural sunlight benefits
notifications to go for a walk
Daily reminder to enjoy the sunlight!
Only 15 min a day can improve your mood and general wellbeing. Put your shoes on!
The purpose of this app is to encourage you to go outside and enjoy the benefits of daylight. Studies have shown that as little as 15 min a day can benefit your well-being and improve your mood.

Sunshine regulates your circadian rhythm by telling your body when to increase and decrease your melatonin levels. So, the more daylight exposure you can get, the better your body will produce melatonin when it’s time to go to sleep.

Melatonin also lowers stress reactivity and being outside will help your body naturally regulate melatonin, which can help reduce your stress level. Additionally, if you\'re doing something active when you’re outside (walking, playing, etc.), that extra exercise also helps to lower stress.

Sunshine boosts your body’s level of serotonin, which is a chemical that improves your mood and helps you stay calm and focused. Increased exposure to natural light may help ease the symptoms of seasonal affective disorder - a change in mood that typically occurs in the fall and winter months when there are fewer hours of daylight.

Our bodies produce vitamin D when exposed to sunlight. Vitamin D is critical for your immune system, and with consistent exposure to sunlight, you can help strengthen it. A healthy immune system can help reduce the risk of illness, infections, some cancers, and mortality after surgery. One of the best ways to get vitamin D is by being outside.
4. Strengthens your immune system and bones
Please be aware that there are many risks associated with sun exposure. Please read NHS Sunscreen and Sun Safety guideline to ensure you are not accidentally harming yourself.
